newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Avantel outlines client, traffic volume.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Avantel outlines client, traffic volume.

text.p: Mexican telephone company Avantel, a joint venture between Banamex-Accival and MCI Communications Corp, said Monday it has about 500,000 residential clients and about 100 corporate clidents.
"We have registered two million minutes of daily traffic in the past two weeks," Avantel marketing director Jorge Rodriguez Soria added at a news conference.

Avantel is one of the top three contenders in long distance carrier wars that began earlier this year. Mexico has been opening the sector city by city to competition after ending the monopoly held by Telefonos de Mexico (Telmex).
Rodriguez said many clients have complained that when signing their presubscription ballots to choose a long distance carrier, Telmex has not handed over the service to the competing carrier.

Avantel also unveiled a new calling card, which will charge a base 2.35 pesos per minute, or less if used frequently. Telmex also introduced a calling card last week. ((--Cyntia Barrera Diaz, Mexico City newsroom +525 728 9549))
